body_html:
The last column and row are ignored. You can think of this as a special case of 'valid' convlolution.

To make it output a 13x13 2d data, you can pad the input using the padding layers, or using the padding= argument to add the padding. However, notice that the padding= only supports symmetrical padding. So if you do padding=1, you actually will have the first column (and row) max pooled with zeros, and the last column (and row) max pooled with the second last.
body_text:
The last column and row are ignored. You can think of this as a special case of 'valid' convlolution.
To make it output a 13x13 2d data, you can pad the input using the padding layers, or using the padding= argument to add the padding. However, notice that the padding= only supports symmetrical padding. So if you do padding=1, you actually will have the first column (and row) max pooled with zeros, and the last column (and row) max pooled with the second last.
body:
The last column and row are ignored. You can think of this as a special case of 'valid' convlolution. 

To make it output a 13x13 2d data, you can pad the input using the padding layers, or using the `padding=` argument to add the padding. However, notice that the `padding=` only supports symmetrical padding. So if you do `padding=1`, you actually will have the first column (and row) max pooled with zeros, and the last column (and row) max pooled with the second last.
